29.body:
Filter for running arbitrary casper.js scripts against the ipython notebook server.

Features:
- [x] Be able to run ipython notebook directly in any subdirectory of project (means original ipynb file(s) may be altered)
- [x] Include bundled scripts for some common tasks/scenarios.

47.body: Fortran compiler (#46) needs to have a directory named 'include'. I am implementing this generally by providing two new settings on SubprocessCompileFilter, 'mkdir' and 'mkdirs' which will cause the specified directory/list of directories to be created in working dir prior to compiler being run.

82.body: The sqlite3 data type has had a 'working file', a temporary sqlite file which resided in the same location where a working directory would normally reside. This makes it impossible to also have a working directory. It should be possible to have both of these.

93.body: Investigate strategies for sectionwise caching. Would require saving the working environment at the end of each section, so it could be loaded from each section break based on which content had changed. May be easier to do for python using the ipython kernel. With R may be possible using .RData files (have already played with this a little).
93.title: implement sectionwise caching

94.body:
Need to be able to put website reporter tags anywhere in dexy content, not just outside of main content block in a separate template file.

The jinja filter should recognize whitelist of tags which are defined by the website reporter and keep these tags unprocessed.

So something like {{ page_title }} would return the string "{{ page_title }}" so it would be interpreted again when page content is processed by jinja as part of the website reporter.
94.title: be able to mix website tags into normal jinja templates

95.body:
In dexy we want to be able to:
- make a link to another dexy document in the same project
- make a link to a particular section in another document
- be able to list all documents & sections (make a global TOC)

This would also be helpful for converting wiki-style content to dexy.
95.title: cross-document links in dexy

96.body: For example, `dexy help` takes more than 5 seconds here to display the help message.

102.body: You might want to render a document without needing to have all software installed to generate inputs. A `dummyjinja` filter would interpret all jinja tags and put some placeholder content in place, so that the tags would not interfere with subsequent processing.
102.title: create a 'dummyjinja' filter

103.body: Provide a way to limit potential side effects by chroot-locking processes spawned by dexy filters by default.
103.title: Provide a 'chroot' option for process filters.
